org.drip.xva.derivative

Class LevelEvolutionTrajectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drip.xva.derivative.LevelEvolutionTrajectory

  • public class LevelEvolutionTrajectory
extends java.lang.Object
    LevelEvolutionTrajectory holds the Evolution Edges of the Trajectory, the Cash Account, and the Derivative Values evolved in a Dynamically Adaptive Manner, as laid out in Burgard and Kjaer (2014). The References are: - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2014): PDE Representations of Derivatives with Bilateral Counter-party Risk and Funding Costs, Journal of Credit Risk, 7 (3) 1-19. - Cesari, G., J. Aquilina, N. Charpillon, X. Filipovic, G. Lee, and L. Manda (2009): Modeling, Pricing, and Hedging Counter-party Credit Exposure - A Technical Guide, Springer Finance, New York. - Gregory, J. (2009): Being Two-faced over Counter-party Credit Risk, Risk 20 (2) 86-90. - Li, B., and Y. Tang (2007): Quantitative Analysis, Derivatives Modeling, and Trading Strategies in the Presence of Counter-party Credit Risk for the Fixed Income Market, World Scientific Publishing, Singapore. - Piterbarg, V. (2010): Funding Beyond Discounting: Collateral Agreements and Derivatives Pricing, Risk 21 (2) 97-102.
    Author:
    Lakshmi Krishnamurthy
